thread.title: 2 Michigan apple-pickers taste wrath of gun-toting woman who owns property, police say
thread.title_full: 2 Michigan apple-pickers taste wrath of gun-toting woman who owns property, police say | OregonLive.com

author: William LaRue, National Desk
title: 2 Michigan apple-pickers taste wrath of gun-toting woman who owns property, police say
text:
A Michigan man and woman found out the hard way not to pick apples anywhere near Shawn Rose Beeler's property.
Beeler, 30, of Boyne Falls has been arrested on felony charges after authorities say she fired a gun at Stacey Smith, 25, and Donald Smith, 37, as they were picking apples Sept. 15 alongside a Northern Michigan road.
The woman first warned the two, both on off-road vehicles, that they were picking apples from private property, MLive.com reports .
The two victims said they never actually stepped foot beyond a fence onto the property, according to Michigan State Department of Natural Resources Capt. Wade Hamilton. He said the apples were hanging over a fence surrounding the property, which Beeler owns.
The Smiths told authorities they dumped the apples on the ground then went nearby to pick apples from another tree, this one growing outside the fence. Beeler then fired at them from an unknown distance using a long gun, police said.
No one was hurt, Charlevoix County sheriff's deputies told PetoskeyNews.com .
The Smiths, both of Boyne Falls, called 911, and a DNR officer helped transport then out of the area. Police later helped retrieve their ORVs, Hamilton said.
Beeler was charged with felonious assault and felony firearm, She was arraigned Sept. 29 in 90th District Court where a judge set a $50,000 bond.
